  • Livi FS smoke sensor

Livi FS Kablosuz Duman Dedektörü Kılavuzu

Description
The Livi FS smoke sensor (hereafter referred to as the sensor) is designed for early fire detection. The sensor operates according to the scattered light method.

The sensor has a smoker warning mode (warning on increase in the smoke concentration).

The sensor switches to the alarm mode if it detects smoke:

  1. The sensor triggers an acoustic alarm, the sensor indicator starts blinking red;
  2. The sensor sends an alarm alert to the Livi Smart Hub (hereafter referred to as the hub).
Sensor appearance
  1. Operation mode indicator
  2. Connection indicator
  3. Enclosure lid
  4. Smoke chamber access hole
  5. Ceiling mounting bracket
  6. Main battery
  7. Operation check button
  8. Tamper button
  9. Protective film for the batter
Binding to the hub
The sensor must be unpacked and allowed to reach room temperature for at least two hours before handling if it was transported or stored at low temperatures.
Only the owner of the site can bind the sensor to the hub. Make sure that the site guard is disabled and the hub is online before binding.
Follow these steps to bind the sensor to the hub:

1. Open the sensor enclosure: hold the ceiling mounting bracket and turn the enclosure lid anticlockwise.

2. Pull the protective film out of the main battery compartment. The sensor indicator will start blinking red once the sensor is switched to the binding mode.

3. In the Livicom app, open the "Devices" screen. In the upper right corner of the screen tap "+" and select "Add Device".

The system compiles a list of radio devices available for binding within the range of the hub radio channel.

4. Select the sensor from the list and check that its name and serial number in the app match the data on the sensor enclosure.

5. Tap CONTINUE and follow on-screen instructions in the app to bind the sensor to the hub.

The connection indicator will blink green 5 times after successful binding.

The sensor switches to the binding mode only for 60 seconds. If you have not bound it to the hub within this period, remove the main battery from the sensor for 30 seconds, and reinstall it (observing polarity). The sensor will switch to binding mode again.
Choosing a location for the sensor
We recommend installing the sensor on the ceiling at the highest point of the room (optimally in the center of the room).
    DO NOT install the sensor:

    • outdoors,
    • at a distance of less than 0.5 m to the nearest corner of the room (for example, in niches, near the top of an A-shaped roof),
    • in places with a high content of dust or suspensions of building materials in the air, as well as in places of smoke (for example, in smoking areas),
    • in places with intense airflow (e.g. near fans, radiators, and air ventilation ducts),
    • in places with high humidity, or at temperatures exceeding the operating temperature range (see "Specifications" table).
    Evaluating signal strength
    Check the quality of the connection between the sensor and the hub at the intended location of the sensor. There are two ways to evaluate the signal strength: :

    1. In the Livicom app, on the sensor settings screen.
    2. With the help of the LED indication on the sensor. Double-click on the tamper button and look at the sensor indicators. Interpret the indication using the table below.
    Signal strength;Indication
    Good signal;The connection indicator blinks green 3 times Average signal;The connection indicator blinks green twice Poor signal; The connection indicator blinks green once No connection;The operation mode indicator blinks red 4 times
    Good signal The connection indicator blinks green 3 times
    Average signal The connection indicator blinks green 2 times
    Poor signal The connection indicator blinks green once
    No connection The power mode indicator blinks red 4 times
    Sensor installation
    Open the sensor enclosure (if it is closed): hold the ceiling mounting bracket (5) and turn the enclosure lid anticlockwise.
    Fasten the ceiling mounting bracket at the selected location with two screws from the supplied mounting kit.

    Close the sensor enclosure: align marks on the enclosure lid and the ceiling mounting bracket, and then turn the lid clockwise to fasten the sensor.
    Checking the sensor operation
    Check the operation of the sensor after its installation. There are three ways to simulate an alarm for the sensor:

    1. Spray a special test aerosol.
    2. Immerse a thin metal wire in the smoke chamber through the hole in the sensor enclosure (4). Hold the wire in the smoke chamber until the sensor triggers an acoustic alarm and the operation mode indicator starts blinking red.
    3. Press the operation check button (7). Use a paper clip to press the button and hold it until a sound and LED notification appear (at least 5 seconds).

    The sensor operates properly if an acoustic alarm sounds continuously and the operation mode indicator blinks red. Contact technical support (mail to: support@livicom.ru) if you see an incorrect indication or do not receive the "Fire" alert in the Livicom app.
    Sensor plate in the Livicom app
    Tap on the Devices button in the Livicom app. The sensor plate appears in the list on the Devices screen after the sensor has been bound to the hub.
    The sensor plate displays:

    1. The name of the sensor.
    2. Sensor icon for quick visual identification.

      When the sensor detects a smoke, you will see on the sensor settings screen:

      • The state of the sensor will change to Alarm! Smoke detected.
      • Sensor icon will turn red.

          Tap on the sensor plate to open the sensor settings screen.
          Sensor settings screen in the Livicom app
          The sensor settings screen displays:

          • Sensor description:
            • name;
            • appearance;
            • type and serial number;
          • Operational parameters:
            • signal strength;
            • main battery status;
            • backup battery status;
            • enclosure status;
            • smoke chamber status.
          • Group. Tap on the group name to move the sensor to another group.

              When the sensor detects a smoke, you will see on the sensor settings screen:

              • The state of the sensor will change to Alarm! Smoke detected (even if the guard is disabled).

              Renaming the sensor
              Only the owner of the site can rename the sensor. Make sure that the site guard is disabled and the hub is online before renaming.
              • In the upper right corner of the sensor settings screen tap on three dots ("Menu" button).
              • Select Rename in the menu.
              • Enter a new name and save it.

              Operational parameters
              Radio signal strength between the sensor and the hub (no connection / poor / average / good):
              • If there is no connection with the hub, check whether the hub is turned on.
              • Check that there are no objects obstructing radio signal (for example, metal objects or mirrors) between the hub and the sensor. Change the sensor installation location so that radio signal could pass between devices without obstructions.
              • Check that the sensor is installed within radio signal range of the hub. If the sensor is installed too far from the hub, move it to a new place where connection between the sensor and the hub will be restored.
              • Check that the hub is turned on. If the hub is off, turn the hub on and again check the signal strength on the sensor settings screen.

              Mail battery status (OK / low battery): If the main battery runs out, the sensor will continue to operate on the backup battery. If one of the batteries runs out, you will receive the "Low battery" push notification in the Livicom app. The notification will also be displayed in the event log in the app and on the sensor settings screen.

              Backup battery status (OK / low battery): If the backup battery runs out, you will receive the notification. The notification will also be displayed in the event log in the app and on the sensor settings screen. Follow instructions as soon as possible to replace the backup battery.

              Enclosure status (open / closed).

              Smoke chamber status: If the smoke chamber of the sensor needs cleaning, you will receive the "Cleaning required" notification. The notification will also be displayed in the event log in the app and on the sensor settings screen. Blow out the smoke chamber with compressed air (for example, with the help of a compressor) to remove dust, and wipe the sensor enclosure with a wet tissue.
              Maintenance
              Keep the sensor free of dust and dirt. Replace the batteries as soon as possible after you receive a "low battery" notification in the Livicom app.

              Dust removal must be performed at least once a year and as soon as possible after you receive a "smoke chamber cleaning required" notification in the Livicom app. Blow out the smoke chamber with compressed air (for example, with the help of a compressor) to remove dust, and wipe the sensor enclosure with a wet tissue.
              Attention

              Do not wipe the sensor with substances containing alcohol, acetone, gasoline and other active solvents
              Replacing the backup battery
              Follow these steps to replace the backup battery:

              1. Open the sensor enclosure and remove the 4 screws located around the main battery compartment. Be careful when working with screws to avoid splines and threads in the plastic.
              2. Remove the enclosure lid, unbend retaining clips and pull out the sensor.
              3. Remove the battery and install a new CR2032 battery, observing polarity.
              4. Reassemble the sensor by following the above steps in reverse order.
              Deleting the sensor (unbinding from the hub)
              Only the owner of the site can unbind the sensor from the hub. Make sure that the site guard is disabled and the hub is online before deleting the sensor.
              There are two ways to unbind the sensor from the hub:

              1. In the Livicom app, using the menu on the sensor settings screen.
              2. Using the tamper (8). If you need to forcefully delete the sensor, remove the main battery from the sensor for 30 seconds, then press the tamper button and while holding it, reinstall the main battery, observing polarity. Release the tamper button and quickly click on it until the operation mode indicator starts blinking red.

              Specifications
              Parameter;Value
              Operating frequency;868 MHz Guaranteed operating range in open areas;up to 1 km Radio channel power;25 mW Sensor sensitivity;0,05-0,2 dB/m Permissible ambient lighting;up to 12000 lx Fire alarm volume level;70 dB Recovery period after an alarm (if no more smoke is detected);1 minute Current consumption in sleep mode;8 μA Current consumption in operation mode;up to 30 mA Main power source (3 V);battery CR123A Backup power source (3 V);battery CR2032 Main battery life;10 years Backup battery life;2 months Operating temperature range;from -20 to +55 °C Relative humidity;no more than 80% at 25 °C Dimensions;110 x 110 x 58 mm
              Operating frequency 868 MHz
              Guaranteed operating range in open areas up to 1 km
              Radio channel power 25 mW
              Sensor sensitivity 0,05-0,2 dB/m
              Permissible ambient lighting up to 12000 lx
              Fire alarm volume level 70 dB
              Recovery period after an alarm (if no more smoke is detected) 1 minute
              Current consumption in sleep mode 8 μA
              Current consumption in operation mode up to 30 mA
              Main power source (3 V) battery CR123A
              Backup power source (3 V) battery CR2032
              Main battery life 10 years
              Backup battery life 2 months
              Operating temperature range from -20 to +55 °C
              Relative humidity no more than 80% at 25 °C
              Dimensions 110 x 110 x 58 mm

              Livi FS smoke sensor 1

              LED and sound indication
              Smoker warning mode (warning on increase in the smoke concentration);Repeating short beeps Alarm mode (sending “Fire” alert to the Livicom app);Acoustic alarm lasts from 1 to 5 minutes and the operation mode indicator blinks red during acoustic alarm Binding mode;The operation mode indicator blinks red for 1 minute Return to normal state;The connection indicator blinks green once Confirmation of successful binding;The connection indicator blinks green 5 times Enclosure of the sensor is open;Short double beep
              Smoker warning mode (warning on increase in the smoke concentration) Repeating short beep
              Alarm mode (sending “Fire” alert to the Livicom app) Acoustic alarm lasting from 1 to 5 minutes and the operation mode indicator blinks red during acoustic alarm
              Return to normal state The connection indicator blinks green once
              Binding mode The operation mode indicator blinks red for 1 minute
              Confirmation of successful binding The connection indicator blinks green 5 times
              Enclosure of the sensor is open Short double beep
              Warranty
              The manufacturer LLC "NPP Stels" guarantees that the sensor meets AGNS.421453.001 TU technical requirements, provided that the consumer complies with the conditions of transportation, storage, installation and operation.

              The warranty period is 5 years from the manufacturing date. The warranty does not apply to batteries.

              The warranty does not cover the following cases:
              1. Non-compliance with the intended operating conditions for the sensor;
              2. Mechanical damage to the sensor;
              3. Repairs to the sensor by a third party (a person or a company other than the Manufacturer).
